item.title: Best RPGs Where You Can Be A Total Jerk To Your Companions
item.description:
Summary

  • RPGs like Pillars of Eternity 2 allow players to be awful to companions, leading to exits or even death.
  • In games like The Outer Worlds, going against companions or factions can have lasting consequences.
  • Titles like Tyranny and Baldur's Gate 3 offer players the option to be rude to companions for unique experiences.

Most role-playing games let players interact with a bunch of lovable companions who aid them in their adventures. For the most part, players will love being nice and cordial with their allies, winning their trust and securing a long-lasting friendship in the process.

However, some RPGs allow players to be completely horrid to their companions. This can breed enmity, lead to exits from the party, or can even result in a character's demise if the player doesn't try to help them out. For some gamers, though, this can be an interesting roleplaying challenge. Here are some great games that let players explore the consquences of being awful to NPCs.

Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire

Some Companions Will Leave If Players Go Against Their Faction

Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire
8.8 /10
Released
May 8, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood and Gore, Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Pillars of Eternity 2 is a great CRPG that takes players on a seafaring adventure. Players explore the Deadfire Archipelago and meet several interesting characters during their travels. This includes a bunch of companions, both returning characters from the previous game and new faces that players will love to interact with. However, if players ignore their companions, fuel animosity, or go against the faction they're aligned with, it can lead to permanent exits and some unhappy companions that won't be okay with what the Watcher did.

The Outer Worlds

Helping The Board Will Anger Everyone

6 Images
6 Images
The Outer Worlds
9 /10
17
8.3 /10
Released
October 25, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

While The Outer Worlds is a short game, the depth of role-playing options encourages players to clock in multiple playthroughs and see the different ways they can tackle the adventure. If players were nice to their party members in one playthrough, then there's nothing stopping them from being rude to them in another one.

Parvati's romance can be stopped, and Vicar Max can be forced into his regimented ways. Ellie will never get the closure from her parents that she deserves, Nyoka will never give a proper sendoff to her fallen comrades, and Felix will forever be deluded about his mentor. To make things worse, players can side with the Board near the end of the game. This will alienate almost every companion and cause them to leave unless players pass a hefty Inspiration check.

Tyranny

It's Almost Impressive How Rude The Protagonist Can Be

6 Images
6 Images
Tyranny
9 /10
Released
November 10, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Players who want to be as evil as they possibly can in an RPG without being forced into a less satisfying path will love what Tyranny brings to the table. In a way, making companions fear the protagonist is actually encouraged, especially since it allows players access to unique dialogue options and team moves in combat.

This is just one of the many reasons why Tyranny is such a unique gem of an RPG that more people need to check out. Even if players are rude to their companions from time to time, they can still help them out and not lose out on their services, which is not something that most other RPGs allow.

Divinity: Original Sin 2

In The Quest To Become A God, Players Can Shelve Other Characters

Divinity: Original Sin 2
8.6 /10
Released
September 14, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Larian Studios are masters of the modern role-playing genre, and Divinity: Original Sin 2 shows this expertise and then some. The RPG mechanics are expanded quite a bit from the first game.

Players can alienate companions with their actions if they wish. To make matters worse, the Godwoken can fight against each other to the death in the race to attain divinity. It's a brutal plot twist that can only be avoided by specific choices and high approvals for each party member, and meeting those conditions is easier said than done.

Dragon Age: Origins

The Protagonist's Behavior Can Lead To Low Approval Ratings

Dragon Age: Origins
9 /10
15
9.3 /10
Released
November 3, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content
Powered by

To this day, many people feel that BioWare is still chasing the lightning they captured with Dragon Age: Origins . The multiple origin stories, amazing role-playing options, and captivating narrative ensured that players would have a blast playing this title.

The future Hero of Ferelden is joined by many companions on their travels, with their Approval meter being tracked throughout the game. As one would expect, this makes it more than viable to be a total jerk to these characters, although they will leave the party if their Approval is too low.

Baldur's Gate 3

Role-Playing Options Include Ways To Berate Allies

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
139
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Baldur's Gate 3 is one of the greatest RPGs of all time, with companion interactions being just one of the many avenues where this title excels. Players will love exploring this amazing title and uncovering a story for the ages with their allies.

All the companions in Baldur's Gate 3 have unique stories of their own that players will love to uncover, but players don't need to pursue these quests. If players wish, they can outright ignore them and deride their companions if they want, although this will lead to some companions prematurely exiting the party.

Mass Effect 2

Loyalties Can Be Earned, Lost, And Forever Broken

Mass Effect 2
8 /10
10
9.0 /10
Released
January 26, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Mass Effect 2 expanded the Companion system quite a bit from its predecessor. Each ally that Shepard recruited had a Loyalty trigger that could be enabled by completing their side quests.

However, these loyalties can be broken during arguments if players can't be efficient mediators, or just want to be rude to a particular companion. Players can also accumulate Renegade points by being total jerks to their companions and other people in the world, although this may come back to bite them during the Suicide Mission.

Fallout: New Vegas

Players Can Sell A Companion That Trusts Them To Caesar's Legion

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas is one of the best RPGs of all time, giving players a ton of options to mold the Courier into whatever image they see fit. During their adventures to reach New Vegas, players will find several companions with unique stories of their own. If players want, they can uncover all these stories and help their friends find closure...or they can sell their companions to Caesar's Legion for a tidy sum. This is just one of the many ways players can be total jerks to their companions and make them meet a grisly fate.

item.title: New Steam Game Has Pokemon and Rusty's Retirement Vibes
item.description:
Players who enjoy casual games have a new release to check out, as Whimside is now available on Steam. To celebrate the game's arrival on Steam, Whimside 's developers are offering a limited-time promotion to encourage players to discover this charming indie game with pixelated graphics and adorable creatures.

Cozy games can help players improve productivity or pass the time, and there are some interesting examples. One example is Spirit City: Lofi Sessions , a game that reminds gamers of the popular YouTube channel Lofi Girl. In this game, they collect spirits, listen to lofi tracks, customize their character and space, and use its features to improve concentration and reduce stress. For those who want a combination of fun graphics and interactivity, Hidden Folks gives the task of finding people hidden in miniature landscapes, with everything in the game being hand-drawn. This time, a new cozy game is available for PC owners, and it mixes features from other well-known titles.

Whimside is a Creature-Collecting Game that Runs at the Bottom of the PC Screen

French developer Toadzillart released Whimside on Steam on Thursday, August 7. This game is based on capturing creatures known as Whimlings, which can be types like green-horned deer or yellow and black foxes. Once captured, players can use the inventory like Pokemon trainers use the Pokedex, seeing which characters they have or don't have. Whimlings can be combined to create a new one, with each combination revealing a new species and unlocking new biomes and decorations. The game features 8,002,800 possible Whimling combinations and shiny variants, so players will always have a new species to discover.

Another notable feature of Whimside is reminiscent of the popular farm simulator Rusty's Retirement , allowing the game to run at the bottom of the screen while the player continues with their activities. In addition to obtaining new Whimlings, players will be able to unlock five biomes and 10 areas that exist in the game, and uncover its secrets and surprises. As they progress through the game, Whimside players will also unlock 182 different decorations to create a personalized space for their Whimlings. Content creators can use the integration with Twitch and stream the game on Amazon's platform.

Whimside is 10% off until Thursday, August 21, bringing the game down to just $5.26. For gamers who want to check out the game before buying it, a free demo is available on Steam. Fans of relaxing games can take the experience a step further by purchasing up to three bundles: the first pairs Whimside with Tiny Aquarium: Social Fishkeeping , the second with Fischer's Fishing Journey , and the third with Tiny Pasture .

item.title: Best Open-World Games With Incredible Attention to Detail
item.description:
Summary

  • Rockstar mastered open-world gaming with GTA 5, offering fans an incredibly detailed experience.
  • Insomniac continues the trend with Marvel's Spider-Man 2, featuring unique animations and fun secrets.
  • The Witcher 3 amazes with beautiful locations full of hidden details, showcasing CD Projekt Red's attention to detail.

Open-world gaming has been the rage for quite some time now. With game development becoming more and more expensive over time, it's easy to see why the most cutting-edge open-world games around are jam-packed with so much detail.

Whether it be in the environment, storytelling, or anything else along the journey, it's easy to see why some fans love the incredible level of detail in these open-world games. It gives them a reason to spend more hours in these games and be wowed by what's on offer.

Grand Theft Auto 5

Rockstar's Patented Attention to Detail Shines in this Game

5 Images
5 Images
Grand Theft Auto 5
9 /10
148
8.9 /10
Released
September 17, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar North
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Rockstar is the king of the open-world genre, with their work on the Grand Theft Auto series cementing the modern sandbox formula that every other developer has tried to emulate. Grand Theft Auto 5 perfects this formula and is full of so much detail that it'll blow fans' minds.

From UFO crashes to hints pointing to the Infinity Killer, there are many details in the open world that keen-eyed fans should be searching for. This, coupled with the intense care that has gone into the game's physics, action, and environments, makes it clear why this game is brimming with so many tantalizing details.

Marvel's Spider-Man 2

From Unique Animations for Zipping Through Fire Escapes to Fun Secrets in the World, There's No Shortage of Fascinating Details

8 Images
8 Images
Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
50
8.9 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Insomniac Games
Publisher(s)
Sony Interactive Entertainment
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Insomniac has proven time and time again why they were the perfect developer for a modern Spider-Man game. From the moment players saw the unique animations for Spider-Man whenever he interacted with a fire escape and the passionate explanation of the developers for adding this it became infinitely clear that Insomniac's attention to detail was a high priority.

Some standout details include how the Spider-Verse outfits boast a lower FPS, thugs who get knocked off ledges are webbed to safety so that they don't die, and the world is full of fun Easter eggs to find that reference various other Marvel properties. All of this combines to ensure that players will have a blast with Marvel's Spider-Man 2 and any of the other games Insomniac has developed.

The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

A Generational Open-World RPG Brimming With Fun Details

6 Images
6 Images
The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
80
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios
Publisher(s)
Bethesda Softworks
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

While Bethesda was always on the map, there's no denying that Skyrim went a long way in ensuring that the company would remain in the gaming pop culture zeitgeist for decades to come. The game is just brimming with a ton of love and handcrafted brilliance that is missing in most of their modern releases.

It helped that the notable locations in Skyrim were jam-packed with a ton of details to flesh out the game's environmental storytelling. From unique secrets to fun encounters scattered across a vast map full of interesting landmarks, it's easy to see why the attention to detail in Skyrim elevates its exploration considerably.

Yakuza 0

The Recreation of Real-Life Japanese Districts is Incredibly Detailed

10 Images
10 Images
Yakuza 0
8.5 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Publisher(s)
Sega
Platform(s)
PlayStation 3, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

All the Yakuza games can technically qualify for this list, given how detailed their environments are. Fans will eventually realize that the locations in these games are almost picture-perfect recreations of real-life districts in popular Japanese cities.

In Yakuza 0 , Sotenbori is based on the Dotonbori district in Osaka, while Kamurocho is a faithful depiction of Kabukicho, an infamous red-light district in Tokyo. The sheer amount of detail present in these locations shows the expertise of the designers in RGG Studio, who did a great job of molding the look of both virtual districts to their real-life counterparts.

Fallout: New Vegas

The Role-Playing in This Game is So Detailed that it Takes the Smallest Actions into Account

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Obsidian Entertainment
Publisher(s)
Bethesda
Platform(s)
PS3, Xbox 360, PC
Powered by

Fallout: New Vegas is celebrated by many fans as the perfect mix of old and new Fallout . It contains the amazing open-world design of the Bethesda Fallout games while embodying the excellent role-playing choices from Interplay's groundbreaking titles.

As a result, the detail present in the role-playing mechanics of Fallout: New Vegas will hammer home just how incredible its gameplay is. Meanwhile, areas like Vault 11 make it clear that even the game's optional locations are positively brimming with detail.

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

The Many Beautiful Locations in this Open World Are Brimming With Fun Details to Find

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
54
9.4 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

Developer(s)
CD Projekt Red
Publisher(s)
CD Projekt Red
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

CD Projekt Red went all out in the development of a great open world in The Witcher 3 . Each and every location in the game is beautiful to explore and brimming with detail that only players with a keen eye can spot.

Players can find a dead "Tyrion" in a crude rendition of the Sky Cells in Skellige, discover a Monty Python tribute featuring the infamous killer rabbit from The Holy Grail , discover a note that is clearly a reference to Breaking Bad , and find several other hidden details in the game. This is on top of the fantastic attention to visual and gameplay detail already present in the game, which do a great job of breathing life into Geralt's open-world adventures.

Red Dead Redemption 2

Rockstar's Greatest Game With a Ton of Details for Players to Uncover

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
168
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar Games
Publisher(s)
Rockstar Games
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Stadia
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Many people consider Red Dead Redemption 2 to be Rockstar's magnum opus, and understandably so. The beautiful open world and incredible story are two of the game's biggest strengths.

Along with this, players love the incredible attention to detail in the game that manifests in many forms. The unique encounters scattered across the game, a cheeky nod to the Manimal glitch from the first Red Dead Redemption , and even the realistic horse poop can go a long way in enhancing a player's immersion.

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild

The Game's Intricate Systems Feed into Each Other Beautifully

The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild
10 /10
47
9.2 /10
Released
March 3, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Nintendo EPD
Publisher(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Wii U, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

One of the many things that wowed players about Breath of the Wild was how the game paid attention to the simplest details. Enemies seemed like they had lives of their own that Link could interrupt, and players could manipulate the game's robust physics engine to either set up cool traps or aid their exploration.

Various notes in Hyrule Castle show a side of Link before the Calamity; Link can get sunburn from staying in the heat for too long; and the ruined structure near decayed Guardians shows them looking at the site of said destruction, making it clear that they were responsible for blowing things up. These details, among countless more scattered across the ruined world, make it clear why Breath of the Wild 's attention to detail is so legendary.

item.title: Guntouchables: How to Increase Your Stamina
item.description:
Guntouchables is a roguelike doomsday shooter video game, where your stamina is the difference between game over and barely survived. Its what fuels your dashes, powers up certain talents, and buys you just enough breathing room to turn disaster into a clutch win. Even though the stamina pool isnt huge, it refills quickly. However, if youre always running out of stamina and stumbling straight into a mutant pileup, you need to learn how to increase your stamina and manage it wisely in Guntouchables .

How to Increase Stamina in Guntouchables

Your stamina bar is the thin, secondary bar beneath your HP, floating above your characters head. Its responsible for actions like dashing and some character-specific attacks. When that bar hits zero, youre locked out of these moves until it regenerates. Even though stamina in Guntouchables refills fairly quickly, its not instant. This split-second delay can still leave you stranded if you mistime your moves.

The best way to increase stamina in Guntouchables is by investing in perks. You can find these in in-run crates or buy them from the between-run shop . Two of the best perks youll want to look out for are:

Perk

Benefit

Stamina Regeneration

Speeds up how quickly your stamina bar refills, so you can get back to dashing and attacking sooner.

Good Cardio

Lowers the stamina cost of dashing, letting you get more dodges before running dry.

Even though these perks dont increase your raw stamina bar size, they improve how far that bar goes during combat. With faster regen and reduced cost, youll almost always be able to get out of trouble.

While perks are the best way to boost your stamina in Guntouchables , consumables like the Primate Energy Drink can grant you infinite stamina for a few seconds, just enough to push through the mutant hordes.

Tips To Manage Stamina in Combat

Increasing stamina is only half the battle; the other half is spending it wisely in Guntouchables . Good management means staying aware of the fights rhythm. Here are some tips to manage stamina in Guntouchables:

  • Dont dash just for the sake of it. Burning stamina to close short gaps can leave you empty when a real threat appears moments later.
  • Plan ahead for incoming waves . If you know a large group is about to spawn, hold back so you can react quickly and use stamina.
  • Use downtime to your advantage. When the fight slows down, thats your chance to spend stamina aggressively and let it recharge before the next push.

8 Images

item.title: Battlefield 6 Developer Explains How Destruction Damage Works in the Game
item.description:
Battlefield 6 developer David Sirland has revealed that destruction damage does indeed affect the player, but not instantaneously. Environmental destruction is one of the key features in Battlefield 6 , the upcoming military shooter scheduled to roll out on October 10.

Thanks to the highly positive response to its public beta, Battlefield 6 has gained significant momentum ahead of its full launch. Even though it is still very early, the EA-published FPS title has already broken the series record for player engagement on Steam and has simultaneously outperformed its rival, Call of Duty , in the same respect. The first phase of the game's open beta was a resounding success, with over 500,000 users logging in on Valve's platform alone. As a result, there is now growing chatter within the Battlefield community about the things shown in the beta version.

Battlefield 6 Clears Potential Doubts about Destruction Damage

In a recent Twitter interaction, David Sirland, one of the lead producers of Battlefield 6 , addressed a beta player's doubts about the perceived minimal damage caused by collapsing structures and similar destruction. The DICE dev clarified that destruction "does do damage" to the player, but "just not instantly." He added that a preference for fun over randomness was a driving factor behind this gameplay decision. Moreover, Sirland also suggested that staying for longer under falling debris impacts the player's health more noticeably, especially with bigger pieces of rubble. He stated that the destruction damage will also be "tuned more" as the studio moves closer to Battlefield 6 's release.

Sirland's statement does offer more clarity about the implementation of in-game destruction in the latest Battlefield entry and should bring relief for players having any qualms about this feature. As confirmed by the DICE veteran, fans should also expect destruction damage to be further improved as the game transitions from its public beta stage to its official launch. However, whether that means the level of damage will become more prominent or more forgiving in future iterations remains to be seen.

Soon, fans will be able to have another go at Battlefield 6 's beta build, thanks to its second round beginning on August 14 till August 17. Given that this will apparently be the only time they get to play the game before its October launch, it would be exciting to see if the upcoming beta phase can outdo the first one. Based on the impressions so far, it may be fair to expect Battlefield 6 's second open beta to attract similar levels of attention as the last time.
